snippet: The pungent aroma of chiles has set off a dispute in Irwindale, Calif., where officials are considering whether to declare the hot sauce plant a public nuisance.
abstract: City Council in Irwindale, Calif, is scheduled to vote on whether to declare Huy Fong Foods factory a public nuisance; move, which would threaten the place where every bottle of trendy hot sauce Sriracha is made, follows lawsuit the city filed in 2013 to force company founder David Tran to stop the pungent smell of chilis from pervading local neighborhoods.
lead_paragraph: The pungent aroma of chiles has set off a dispute in Irwindale, Calif., where officials are considering whether to declare the hot sauce plant a public nuisance.

headline.main: Sriracha Factory Irritates Some California Noses, but Entices Politicians
